User-Agent:       Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 5.1; Trident/4.0; GTB0.0; .NET CLR 1.1.4322; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.0.4506.2152; .NET CLR 3.5.30729)
Build Identifier: Firefox 4.0

After upgrade from Firefox 3.6 to Firefox 4.0, our internal webpage that was Joomlar 1.5 based would encounter the following error:
Illegal variable _files or _env or _get or _post or _cookie or _server or _session or globals passed to script.

Tried with Google Chrome to reach the same Joomlar 1.5 internal webpage, fine.
Tried with IE8 (8.0.6001.18702), same error as shown above.
Use Firefox 4.0 to reach our internal webpage that is not joomla 1.5 based, fine.

Downgrade Firefox back to 3.6, reach the same Joomla 1.5 page, fine again.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Upgrade Firefox from 3.6 to 4.0 after download from the website.
2.Try to reach known Joomla 1.5 based website.
3.If encounter the error as in descibed in the detail area, downgrade Firefox back to 3.6 and try again to reach the Joomla 1.5 based website again to see.
Actual Results:  
Illegal variable _files or _env or _get or _post or _cookie or _server or _session or globals passed to script.

Expected Results:  
It should work fine to reach Joomla 1.5 based webpage fine as with Firefox 3.6.

Our page was built based on Joomla 1.5 and use internally of our company, so could not get to it from outside of our company.
